person.persName: John G Foster (New Hampshire military man)

body.p: Born May 27, 1823 in Whitefield, New Hampshire. Attended school in Nashua, then studied at the Hancock (NH) academy. Appointed to West Point by U.S. Representative Charles G. Atherton, and graduated fourth in the class of 1847. Breveted a Second Lieutenant of Engineers. Served in Mexican-American War from 1847-1848. Worked on coastal survey office and as assisant to professor of engeinnering at West Point from 1855-1857. Worked on the consturction of Fort Sumter in 1858. Commissioned as a full captain of engineers on July 1, 1860. Appointed brigadier general of volunteers October 23, 1861. In command of the department of North Carolina July 1, 1862-July 13, 1863. Breveted a major general of United States Volunteers July 18, 1863. Commanded the Department of Ohio December 12, 1863-July 9, 1864. Died on September 2, 1874.
